Constant module¶

Created on Mon Jun 01 16:56:55 2015 @author: etienne

class Constant.MatPass¶

This class contains all the transition matrix from RGB to XYZ space

Variables:
  • AdobRGB – Adobe RGB, use with D65 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • AppleRGB – Apple RGB, use with D65 standard illuminant and = 1.8
  • BestRGB – Best RGB, use with D50 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • BetaRGB – Beta RGB, use with D50 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • BruceRGB – Bruce RGB, use with D65 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • CIERGB – CIE RGB, use with E standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • CmatchRGB – ColorMatch RGB, use with D50 standard illuminant and = 1.8
  • DonRGB4 – Don RGB4, use with D50 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • ECIRGB – ECI RGB, use with D50 standard illuminant and = L
  • ESPS5 – Ekta Space PS5, use with D50 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • NTSCRGB – NTSC RGB, use with C standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • PSRGB – Pal/secam RGB, use with D65 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • PPRGB – Prophoto RGB, use with D50 standard illuminant and = 1.8
  • SMPT_CRGB – SMPTE-C RGB, use with D65 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • sRGB – sRGB, use with D65 standard illuminant and = 2.2
  • WGRGB – Wide Gamut RGB, use with D50 standard illuminant and = 2.2

class Constant.stdIlluminant¶

This class contains the standard illuminant referenced in the Constant.MatPass.

Variables:
  • A – CIE standard illuminant A (domestic tungsten filament lighting)
  • C – CIE standard illuminant C (daylight simulator: average day light) -DEPRECATED
  • D50 – CIE standard illuminant D50 (horizon light)
  • D55 – CIE standard illuminant D55 (Mid-morning/afternoon daylight)
  • D65 – CIE standard illuminant D65 (Noon daylight)
  • D75 – CIE standard illuminant D75 (North sky daylight)
  • E – CIE standard illuminant E (equal energy radiator)
  • F2 – CIE standard illuminant F2 (Cool white fluorescent)
  • F7 – CIE standard illuminant F7 (D65 simulator)
  • F11 – CIE standard illuminant F11 (Philips TL84, Ultralume 40)
A = [1.0985, 1.0, 0.35585]¶
C = [0.98074, 1.0, 1.18232]¶
